page.title: 04STEAM IN STOTFOLD
page.content: Mr{J.Saunders}is well known in the area for his collection of{steam engines.He has collected and revovated four since 1961 when his father began the collection. The{Burrel steam engine}was built in 1925 designed as an electricity generator on fairgrounds. The{Fowler steam roller}(1921)was designed as a road roller.It was last used in 1961 on the A1_Biggleswade bypass. { Wallis and Stevens Traction Engine {1919}was used on farms to thresh the corn.It has a 7h.p.engine. {Garret Steam Tractor(1921)}was used for light haulage. He has also restored a{89 key {Gavioli}military band steam organ. He spends all his spare time polishing and restoring these{giants {of a past age.
